com.noctarius.borabora

Enum ValueTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ValueTypes>
      • com.noctarius.borabora.ValueTypes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueType, Serializable, Comparable<ValueTypes>

    public enum ValueTypes
extends Enum<ValueTypes>
implements ValueType
    The ValueTypes class is a set of prebuilt ValueType implementations. They define the common basic MajorTypes, as well as some integrated semantic tag types and super types to group different types.
    See Also:
    ValueType, MajorType

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      Bool
      Bool defines a value type representing a boolean (true / false) value.
      ByteString
      ByteString defines a value type for ASCII only strings.
      DateTime
      DateTime defines a value type of date and time.
      Dictionary
      Dictionary defines a value type representing a collection of key-value pairs.
      EncCBOR
      EncCBOR represents a value type of still encoded CBOR.
      Float
      Float defines a value type representing a floating point value of either of the types: HalfPrecisionFloat, Float Double.
      Fraction
      Fraction represents a value type of a floating point number outside the representable range of Float.
      Int
      Int defines a group of integer related types, like UInt, NInt, UBigNum, ...
      NBigNum
      NBigNum represents a value type of a negative integer smaller than Long.MIN_VALUE which cannot be represented without a BigInteger anymore.
      NInt
      NInt defines a value type for MajorType.NegativeInteger.
      Null
      Null defines a value type representing a null value.
      Number
      Number defines a group of number related types, like UInt, NInt, Float, ...
      Sequence
      Sequence defines a value type representing a collection of values.
      String
      String defines a group for the string value types ByteString and TextString.
      TextString
      ByteString defines a value type for UTF-8 encoded strings.
      Timestamp
      Timestamp defines a value type representing a timestamp value of seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC.

      UBigNum represents a value type of an unsigned integer bigger than Long.MAX_VALUE which cannot be represented without a BigInteger anymore.

      Undefined
      Undefined defines a simple value of an undefined type.
      Unknown
      Unknown represents a value of an unknown type.
      URI
      URI represents a value type of an URI encoded value.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • Number

        public static final ValueTypes Number
        Number defines a group of number related types, like UInt, NInt, Float, ...

      • Int

        public static final ValueTypes Int
        Int defines a group of integer related types, like UInt, NInt, UBigNum, ...

      • UInt

        public static final ValueTypes UInt
        UInt defines a value type for MajorType.UnsignedInteger. It is also defined as part of the groups Int and Number.

      • NInt

        public static final ValueTypes NInt
        NInt defines a value type for MajorType.NegativeInteger. It is also defined as part of the groups Int and Number.

      • String

        public static final ValueTypes String
        String defines a group for the string value types ByteString and TextString.

      • ByteString

        public static final ValueTypes ByteString
        ByteString defines a value type for ASCII only strings. It is also defined as part of the group String.

      • TextString

        public static final ValueTypes TextString
        ByteString defines a value type for UTF-8 encoded strings. It is also defined as part of the group String.

      • Sequence

        public static final ValueTypes Sequence
        Sequence defines a value type representing a collection of values. Each element in a sequence can have a different value type, and sequences can have a fixed element count or represent an indefinite number of elements. In the latter case borabora does a quick pre-scan to find the number and offsets of the elements.

      • Dictionary

        public static final ValueTypes Dictionary
        Dictionary defines a value type representing a collection of key-value pairs. Each key and each value in a dictionary can have a different value types, and dictionaries can have a fixed pair count or represent an indefinite number of pairs. In the latter case borabora does a quick pre-scan to find the number and offsets of the pair-elements.

      • Float

        public static final ValueTypes Float
        Float defines a value type representing a floating point value of either of the types: HalfPrecisionFloat, Float Double.

      • Bool

        public static final ValueTypes Bool
        Bool defines a value type representing a boolean (true / false) value.

      • Null

        public static final ValueTypes Null
        Null defines a value type representing a null value.

      • Undefined

        public static final ValueTypes Undefined
        Undefined defines a simple value of an undefined type. Currently CBOR defines null, true, false as simple values, however the specification is extensible to add more simple values at a later type.

      • DateTime

        public static final ValueTypes DateTime
        DateTime defines a value type of date and time. The value is stored as a semantic tag and a string. The DateTime encoding is defined to be based on RFC 3339 and refined by RFC 4287.

      • Timestamp

        public static final ValueTypes Timestamp
        Timestamp defines a value type representing a timestamp value of seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC. The value is of 64 bit and will not exceed at 2038-01-19 03:14:08 UTC.

      • UBigNum

        public static final ValueTypes UBigNum
        UBigNum represents a value type of an unsigned integer bigger than Long.MAX_VALUE which cannot be represented without a BigInteger anymore.

      • NBigNum

        public static final ValueTypes NBigNum
        NBigNum represents a value type of a negative integer smaller than Long.MIN_VALUE which cannot be represented without a BigInteger anymore.

      • Fraction

        public static final ValueTypes Fraction
        Fraction represents a value type of a floating point number outside the representable range of Float. The value will be represented as a BigDecimal.

      • EncCBOR

        public static final ValueTypes EncCBOR
        EncCBOR represents a value type of still encoded CBOR. The value is represented to the user as a Value.

      • URI

        public static final ValueTypes URI
        URI represents a value type of an URI encoded value. the URI type is represented in Java as a URI value.

      • Unknown

        public static final ValueTypes Unknown
        Unknown represents a value of an unknown type. The value can still be extracted using Parser.extract(Input, long). Unknown type can happen for semantic tags which are not known to the parser, however this is valid to the CBOR specifications as long as the parser is able to ignore the type itself.

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static ValueTypes[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (ValueTypes c : ValueTypes.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static ValueTypes valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • identity

        public ValueType identity()
        Description copied from interface: ValueType
        Returns a specific identity in case the value type has a super type. For example UInt has the identity of Int which itself has the identity of Number.
        Specified by:
        identity in interface ValueType
        Returns:
        the identity in case of defined, otherwise the value type itself

      • value

        public <T> T value(Value value,
                   boolean validate)
        Description copied from interface: ValueType
        Returns the extracted Value based on this value type. Calling this method with validate set to false is equivalent ValueType.value(Value, boolean).
        Specified by:
        value in interface ValueType
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the extracted value
        Parameters:
        value - the value instance to extract the value from
        validate - validate the value or not
        Returns:
        the extracted value
